ygData.subject: Re: HTMLExtractor

Hello Gordon,

thanks for the quick reply. Attached you find the crawl log =
and the messages of the command line tool : ./htmlextractor
The configurati=
on works with other seeds therefore I assumed that the configuration is cor=
rect. I tried a lot of changes in the configuration but without success. Bu=
t there could be a fundamental error. 
I am using heritrix-1.14.3, but I al=
so tried the htmlextractor command line tool of heritrix 3 without success.=

In the arc file the content is binary too (Content-Type: text/html; charse=
t=3DUTF-8 Content-Encoding: x-gzip) - see below. 
I am located in Germany a=
nd the IP address of the server delivering the web site is 62.96.140.140. 
=

I don't know which changes in the configuration I can make. Should I post =
the order.xml?
Thanks. 

Best regards,
 Christian

ard default configuration, and in both cases:

he 'index.html.gz' version are served as

n
